intro: Frankenia transkaratavica, commonly known as the Karatava frankenia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Namibia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves adapted to water conservation. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer, adding a vibrant touch to its harsh environment. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
